body: Can you please explain what "won't work" with examples, error messages, stack traces, etc.?
@fstarred Could you please provide a minimal reproducible sample project?

> Check the attached zip
> 
> [junit-issue.zip](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/files/4274827/junit-issue.zip)

Didn't run the sample, yet. Two remarks regarding the `pom.xml`:

>        <maven.compiler.source>1.7</maven.compiler.source>
>        <maven.compiler.target>1.7</maven.compiler.target>

JUnit 5 requires Java 8+.

>                <plugin>
>                    <artifactId>maven-surefire-plugin</artifactId>
>                    <version>2.22.1</version>
>                </plugin>

Upgrade Surefire to `2.22.2` or even `3.0.0-M4`.

Modified java version and surefire plugin (tried with 2.22.2 and 3.0.0-M1, I dropped with M4 because of some compilation errors instead).
Still doesn't work
Hope you can remove the label " waiting for feedback" now :)
Tentatively slated for 5.7 M1 for _team discussion_

[`org.jboss.weld:weld-junit5:2.0.1.Final`](https://search.maven.org/artifact/org.jboss.weld/weld-junit5/2.0.1.Final/pom) depends on

```xml
<!--JUnit 5 dependencies -->
<dependency>
  <groupId>org.junit.jupiter</groupId>
  <artifactId>junit-jupiter-api</artifactId>
</dependency>
<dependency>
  <groupId>org.junit.jupiter</groupId>
  <artifactId>junit-jupiter-engine</artifactId>
</dependency>
```

The linked parent [org.jboss.weld:weld-junit-parent:2.0.1.Final](https://search.maven.org/artifact/org.jboss.weld/weld-junit-parent/2.0.1.Final/pom) contains:

```xml
<properties>
  <version.junit4>4.12</version.junit4>
  <version.junit.jupiter>5.4.1</version.junit.jupiter>
</properties>
```

That in turn refers to JUnit Platform `1.4.1` modules.

When you instruct Maven to use a current version of Jupiter, here `5.6.0`, you also need tell Maven to use the matching JUnit Platform modules. For example like this:

```xml
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.junit.platform</groupId>
            <artifactId>junit-platform-launcher</artifactId>
            <version>1.6.0</version>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>
``` 

Adding the dependency to like above, yields:

```text
...
[INFO] --- maven-surefire-plugin:2.22.1:test (default-test) @ junit-issue ---
```
